author: Carol Sottili
title: The week’s best travel deals from around the globe
text:
Beachgoers at Waikiki Beach in Hono­lulu. United is offering discounts on fares from Washington, D.C. (Marco Garcia/Reuters) By Carol Sottili and Andrea Sachs August 27 Follow @carolsottili This week’s best travel bargains around the globe.
Land Save nearly $300 on the Flights & Flies package at Antlers at Vail in Colorado . The deal costs $324 per person double and includes two nights in a one-bedroom condo (normally from $280 per night), a half-day guided fly-fishing trip and two vouchers for the 10th Mountain Whiskey & Spirit Co., good for a flight of five of spirits , a souvenir rocks glass and a $5 gift certificate for the gift shop. Add about 10 percent tax. Travel Sept. 1-
Nov. 15. Info: 970-476-2471, www.antlersvail.com/specials.
Carol Sottili is a former Washington Post travel writer, specializing in travel deals. View Archive Hotel Christopher, an oceanfront resort on the Caribbean island of St. Barts , is offering a package with l odging, breakfasts, car rental and taxes. Stay at least three nights in November or between April 17 and Aug. 21. For example, three nights in mid-November in an ocean-view junior suite starts at $1,687 per couple, a savings of $445. Info: 800-550-1769, www.hotelchristopher.com/offers/10-b-b-car-package .
The Omni Mount Washington Resort in Bretton Woods, N.H., is offering a package with a free activity of your choice. The Rest and Recreation package includes lodging and a choice of $100 spa credit , a ski ticket for Bretton Woods with lunch (available November -April), 18 holes of golf with a cart and lunch (May-October; rates normally from $49) or a canopy tour (value $110). Prices vary. For example, in mid-October, the package starts at $502 for two people in a traditional room with a queen bed. No travel restrictions but some dates are sold out.
Info: 603-278-1000, www.omnihotels.com.
Sea Crystal Cruises has discounted more than a dozen cruises in Europe, Asia and the Caribbean . For example, a seven-night cruise from Monte Carlo to Valletta, Malta, on Oct. 25 or the reverse itinerary departing Oct. 31 starts at $1,750 per person double, a savings of $748. Add $250 port charges. Fares include beverages and tips. Book by Aug. 31. Info: 888-722-0021, www.crystalcruises.com .
Air United has a fare sale from Washington Dulles or BWI Marshall to Hawaii . For instance, round-trip fares from Dulles to Hono­lulu start at $722 with taxes; air from BWI to Kona on the Big Island is from $811 . For Kona, fares on other airlines start at $875. Book seven days in advance by Aug. 31. Travel Monday-Thursday and complete travel by Dec. 17. Holiday blackout dates apply. Info: www.united.com .
Scandinavian Airlines has launched a sale for flights between Washington Dulles and eight cities in Europe . For example, round-trip fare to Stockholm starts at $697 , including taxes; fare on other airlines starts at $886. Travel November-May. Cheapest fares apply to Monday-Thursday travel; Saturday night stay required. Some dates are sold out. Book by Sept. 1 at www.flysas.com .
Package Book any of seven European holiday itineraries with Sceptre Tours and each traveler receives a $100 American Express gift card . For example, the Parisian Christmas package starts at $1,732 per person double and includes round-trip air from Washington Dulles to Paris, five nights at the Hotel Central Saint-Germain, breakfasts, a 48-hour hop-on/hop-off bus tour pass, a walking tour and taxes. Travel Nov. 1 to Jan. 15. Book by Sept. 30 at 800-221-0924 and request promo code HOLIDAY15. Info: www.sceptretours.com/vacation-packages/holidays .
— Carol Sottili , Andrea Sachs
Submit travel deals to whatsthedeal@washpost.com . Prices were verified at press time Thursday, but deals sell out and availability is not guaranteed. Some restrictions may apply.
